material-property-value-condition.content:
Please analyze the following paragraph and summarize the properties, including their numerical values, of the mentioned materials.

Paragraph: Such high energy alignment would not enable to achieve a large open - circuit voltage and is eventually detrimental to the PCE output of PT - based PSCs such as in P3HT / PCBM systems with PCE ranging from 3 to 4% . 21,22 Geng and co-workers synthesized two PT - based donor materials by incorporating carboxylate side chains and vinylene linkers between thiophene units. The HOMO and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels of the resulting polymers , PBT and PTT , were substantially stabilized when compared to those of the parent P3HT. Such energy level lowering was attributed to the integration of carboxylate and vinylene groups giving rise to a push - pull structural motif , resulting in an enhanced PCE of the PV devices based on them. 21 Over the years , the use of the structural effect to enhance PSC performance has been extensively investigated , particularly the donor - acceptor ( D-A ) strategy , which has been proved to be an effective approach to develop donor polymers with wide absorption , low - lying energy levels , and enhanced electron properties. 23-32 Besides , conjugation expansion on the polymer backbone is an alternative tool to improve the electronic properties of polymers. By replacing a branched 2ethylhexyl side chain with a linear n-octyl group , Zhang and his co-workers synthesized a PTB7-Th derivative namely , PBTT. PV cells based on PBTT : IEICO showed a superior device performance than that of the PTB7-Th - based device with a PCE of 9.5% , a V oc of 0.86 V , a J sc of 17.9 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 61.3% . Such dramatic enhancement in efficiency was attributed to a higher charge mobility and improved morphology of the PBTT : IEICO blend film induced by the less steric hindered linear alkyl side chain. 1 Yang and coworkers used selenophene to replace thiophene π-bridge in the indacenodithiophene (IDT)-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c′]dithiophene-4,8-dione (BDD)-based copolymer ( PThBDDIDT ) to develop a donor-π-acceptor type copolymer , PSeBDDIDT. The PCE of solar cells based on polymer : PC71BM as an active layer was dramatically increased from 7.04 to 8.65% , respectively. Such improvement could result from stronger intermolecular interactions , expanded absorption range , and better molecular planarity of selenophene contained PSeBDDIDT. 33 Random terpolymers comprised of thieno[2′,3′ : 5′,6′]pyrido [ 3,4- g]- thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione , thiophene( T ) , and dithiophene ( 2T ) were synthesized by Yang and co-workers in which the crystallinity of terpolymers could be controlled by varying the compositions of T and 2T. The PSC based on a terpolymer with the optimized T / 2T ratio of 7 : 3 showed a high J sc of 18.3 mA cm^-2 and a FF of 71.2% , thus resulting in an enhanced PCE up to 10.8% . 34 Fluorination on polymer backbones has also been widely adopted to tune and improve the functional properties of donor polymers such as stabilization of their energy levels and hence positively impacting on PSC performance.

Let's think step by step.

First, let's identify the materials mentioned in the paragraph and their properties:

1. P3HT: a polymer with a PCE range of 3-4%
2. PBT and PTT: polymers synthesized by Geng and co-workers, with stabilized HOMO and LUMO energy levels, and an enhanced PCE in PV devices.
3. PBTT: a polymer synthesized by Zhang and co-workers, with a linear n-octyl side chain, showing improved electronic properties and device performance.
4. PThBDDIDT: a copolymer developed by Yang and co-workers, with a donor-π-acceptor structure, showing improved intermolecular interactions, expanded absorption range, and better molecular planarity.
5. Random terpolymers: terpolymers synthesized by Yang and co-workers, composed of thieno[2′,3′:5′,6′]pyrido[3,4-g]-thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione, thiophene, and dithiophene, with controlled crystallinity and improved PSC performance.
6. Fluorinated polymers: polymers with fluorination on their backbones, which can stabilize their energy levels and improve PSC performance.

Now, let's summarize the numerical values mentioned in the paragraph:

1. PCE range of P3HT: 3-4%
2. PCE of PBT and PTT: not specified
3. PCE of PBTT: 9.5%
4. PCE of PThBDDIDT: 8.65%
5. PCE of terpolymer with optimized T/2T ratio: 10.8%
6. HOMO and LUMO energy levels of PBT and PTT: stabilized
7. Charge mobility of PBTT: improved
8. Jsc of PBTT: 17.9 mA cm^-2
9. FF of PBTT: 61.3%
10. Voc of PBTT: 0.86 V
11. Jsc of terpolymer with optimized T/2T ratio: 18.3 mA cm^-2
12. FF of terpolymer with optimized T/2T ratio: 71.2%
13. Voc of terpolymer with optimized T/2T ratio: not specified

Lastly, let's discuss the main findings and trends mentioned in the paragraph:

1. The incorporation of carboxylate side chains and vinylene linkers in PT-based donor materials can stabilize their energy levels and improve PCE.
2. Replacing branched side chains with linear alkyl side chains can improve electronic properties and device performance.
3. Selenophene can be used as a π-bridge in donor-π-acceptor type copolymers, leading to improved intermolecular interactions, expanded absorption range, and better molecular planarity.
4. Random terpolymers with controlled crystallinity can show improved PSC performance.
5. Fluorination on polymer backbones can stabilize energy levels and improve PSC performance.

In summary, the paragraph discusses various strategies to improve the performance of polymer solar cells, including the use of donor materials with stabilized energy levels, linear side chains, and π-bridges, as well as the control of crystallinity and fluorination of polymers.

If exists, please present the valid relationships as a Markdown table with columns "['Material Name', 'Material Property', 'Material Property (Abbr.)', 'Numerical Value', 'Condition']". Make sure the table items are from the original paragraph.

| Material Name | Material Property | Material Property (Abbr.) | Numerical Value | Condition |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| P3HT | PCE | - | 3-4% | - |
| PBT | PCE | - | - | Synthesized by Geng and co-workers |
| PTT | PCE | - | - | Synthesized by Geng and co-workers |
| PBTT | PCE | - | 9.5% | Replacing branched side chains with linear alkyl side chains |
| PThBDDIDT | PCE | - | 8.65% | Using selenophene as a π-bridge |
| Terpolymer | PCE | - | 10.8% | Optimized T/2T ratio |
| Terpolymer | Jsc | - | 18.3 mA cm^-2 | Optimized T/2T ratio |
| Terpolymer | FF | - | 71.2% | Optimized T/2T ratio |
| Terpolymer | Voc | - | 0.86 V | Optimized T/2T ratio |

Note: The "Condition" column lists the condition mentioned in the paragraph that applies to the corresponding material property.
